docstr: `IMAGE_INDEX` â€” Function that converts a cosubscript to an image index ### Description Returns the image index belonging to a cosubscript. ### Syntax `RESULT = IMAGE_INDEX(COARRAY, SUB)` ### Return value Scalar default integer with the value of the image index which corresponds to the cosubscripts. For invalid cosubscripts the result is zero. ### Example ``` INTEGER :: array[2,-1:4,8,*] ! Writes 28 (or 0 if there are fewer than 28 images) WRITE (*,*) IMAGE_INDEX (array, [2,0,3,1]) ``` ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Inquiry function. ### See also THIS_IMAGE, NUM_IMAGES
